00043 
00044     template <class ValueType, class TriggerEntryType>
00045     struct sorted_runs
00046     {
00047         typedef TriggerEntryType trigger_entry_type;
00048         typedef ValueType value_type;
00049         typedef typename trigger_entry_type::bid_type bid_type;
00050         typedef stxxl::int64 size_type;
00051         typedef std::vector<trigger_entry_type> run_type;
00052         typedef typed_block<bid_type::size, value_type> block_type;
00053         size_type elements;
00054         std::vector<run_type> runs;
00055         std::vector<unsigned_type> runs_sizes;
00056 
00057         // Optimization:
00058         // if the input is small such that its total size is
00059         // less than B (block_type::size)
00060         // then input is sorted internally
00061         // and kept in the array "small"
00062         std::vector<ValueType> small_;
00063 
00064         sorted_runs() : elements(0) { }
00065 
00070         void deallocate_blocks()
00071         {
00072             block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00073             for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < runs.size(); ++i)
00074                 bm->delete_blocks(
00075                     trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (runs[i].begin()),
00076                     trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (runs[i].end()) );
00077 
00078 
00079             runs.clear();
00080         }
00081     };
00082 
00090     template <
00091               class Input_,
00092               class Cmp_,
00093               unsigned BlockSize_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE (typename Input_::value_type),
00094               class AllocStr_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY>
00095     class runs_creator
00096     {
00097         Input_ &input;
00098         Cmp_ cmp;
00099     public:
00100         typedef Cmp_ cmp_type;
00101         typedef typename Input_::value_type value_type;
00102         typedef BID<BlockSize_> bid_type;
00103         typedef typed_block<BlockSize_, value_type> block_type;
00104         typedef sort_local::trigger_entry<bid_type, value_type> trigger_entry_type;
00105         typedef sorted_runs<value_type, trigger_entry_type> sorted_runs_type;
00106     private:
00107         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::run_type run_type;
00108         sorted_runs_type result_; // stores the result (sorted runs)
00109         unsigned_type m_; // memory for internal use in blocks
00110         bool result_computed; // true result is already computed (used in 'result' method)
00111 
00112         runs_creator(); // default construction is forbidden
00113         runs_creator(const runs_creator & ); // copy construction is forbidden
00114         runs_creator & operator = (const runs_creator &); // copying is forbidden
00115 
00116 
00117         void compute_result();
00118         void sort_run(block_type * run, unsigned_type elements)
00119         {
00120             if (block_type::has_filler)
00121                 std::sort(
00122                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor <
00123                                                 block_type,
00124                                                 value_type,
00125                                                 block_type::size > (run, 0 ),
00126                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor<
00127                                                block_type,
00128                                                value_type,
00129                                                block_type::size > (run,
00130                                                                    elements ),
00131                     cmp);
00132 
00133             else
00134                 std::sort(run[0].elem, run[0].elem + elements, cmp);
00135         }
00136     public:
00141         runs_creator(Input_ & i, Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
00142             input(i), cmp(c), m_(memory_to_use / BlockSize_ / sort_memory_usage_factor()), result_computed(false)
00143         {
00144             assert (2 * BlockSize_ * sort_memory_usage_factor() <= memory_to_use);
00145         }
00146 
00150         const sorted_runs_type & result()
00151         {
00152             if (!result_computed)
00153             {
00154                 compute_result();
00155                 result_computed = true;
00156 #ifdef STXXL_PRINT_STAT_AFTER_RF
00157                 STXXL_MSG(*stats::get_instance());
00158 #endif
00159             }
00160             return result_;
00161         }
00162     };
00163 
00164 
00165     template <class Input_, class Cmp_, unsigned BlockSize_, class AllocStr_>
00166     void runs_creator<Input_, Cmp_, BlockSize_, AllocStr_>::compute_result()
00167     {
00168         unsigned_type i = 0;
00169         unsigned_type m2 = m_ / 2;
00170         const unsigned_type el_in_run = m2 * block_type::size; // # el in a run
00171         STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_creator::compute_result m2=" << m2);
00172         unsigned_type pos = 0;
00173 
00174 #ifndef STXXL_SMALL_INPUT_PSORT_OPT
00175         block_type * Blocks1 = new block_type[m2 * 2];
00176 #else
00177         /*
00178            block_type * Blocks1 = new block_type[1];       // allocate only one block first
00179                                                                                 // if needed reallocate
00180            while(!input.empty() && pos != block_type::size)
00181            {
00182            Blocks1[pos/block_type::size][pos%block_type::size] = *input;
00183          ++input;
00184          ++pos;
00185            }*/
00186 
00187 
00188         while (!input.empty() && pos != block_type::size)
00189         {
00190             result_.small_.push_back(*input);
00191             ++input;
00192             ++pos;
00193         }
00194 
00195         block_type * Blocks1;
00196 
00197         if ( pos == block_type::size )
00198         {      // ennlarge/reallocate Blocks1 array
00199             block_type * NewBlocks = new block_type[m2 * 2];
00200             std::copy(result_.small_.begin(), result_.small_.end(), NewBlocks[0].begin());
00201             result_.small_.clear();
00202             //delete [] Blocks1;
00203             Blocks1 = NewBlocks;
00204         }
00205         else
00206         {
00207             STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_creator: Small input optimization, input length: " << pos);
00208             result_.elements = pos;
00209             std::sort(result_.small_.begin(), result_.small_.end(), cmp);
00210             return;
00211         }
00212 #endif
00213 
00214         while (!input.empty() && pos != el_in_run)
00215         {
00216             Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = *input;
00217             ++input;
00218             ++pos;
00219         }
00220 
00221         // sort first run
00222         sort_run(Blocks1, pos);
00223         result_.elements = pos;
00224         if (pos < block_type::size && input.empty() ) // small input, do not flush it on the disk(s)
00225         {
00226             STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_creator: Small input optimization, input length: " << pos);
00227             result_.small_.resize(pos);
00228             std::copy(Blocks1[0].begin(), Blocks1[0].begin() + pos, result_.small_.begin());
00229             delete [] Blocks1;
00230             return;
00231         }
00232 
00233 
00234         block_type * Blocks2 = Blocks1 + m2;
00235         block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00236         request_ptr * write_reqs = new request_ptr[m2];
00237         run_type run;
00238 
00239 
00240         unsigned_type cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(pos, block_type::size); // in blocks
00241         run.resize(cur_run_size);
00242         bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00243                        trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.begin()),
00244                        trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.end())
00245         );
00246 
00247         disk_queues::get_instance ()->set_priority_op(disk_queue::WRITE);
00248 
00249         result_.runs_sizes.push_back(pos);
00250 
00251         // fill the rest of the last block with max values
00252         for ( ; pos != el_in_run; ++pos)
00253             Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = cmp.max_value();
00254 
00255 
00256         for (i = 0; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00257         {
00258             run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00259             write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00260             //STXXL_MSG("BID: "<<run[i].bid<<" val: "<<run[i].value);
00261         }
00262         result_.runs.push_back(run); // #
00263 
00264         if (input.empty())
00265         {
00266             // return
00267             wait_all(write_reqs, write_reqs + cur_run_size);
00268             delete [] write_reqs;
00269             delete [] Blocks1;
00270             return;
00271         }
00272 
00273         STXXL_VERBOSE1("Filling the second part of the allocated blocks");
00274         pos = 0;
00275         while (!input.empty() && pos != el_in_run)
00276         {
00277             Blocks2[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = *input;
00278             ++input;
00279             ++pos;
00280         }
00281         result_.elements += pos;
00282 
00283         if (input.empty())
00284         {
00285             // (re)sort internally and return
00286             pos += el_in_run;
00287             sort_run(Blocks1, pos); // sort first an second run together
00288             wait_all(write_reqs, write_reqs + cur_run_size);
00289             bm->delete_blocks(trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.begin()),
00290                               trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.end()) );
00291 
00292             cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(pos, block_type::size);
00293             run.resize(cur_run_size);
00294             bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00295                            trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.begin()),
00296                            trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.end())
00297             );
00298 
00299             result_.runs_sizes[0] = pos;
00300             // fill the rest of the last block with max values
00301             for ( ; pos != 2 * el_in_run; ++pos)
00302                 Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = cmp.max_value();
00303 
00304 
00305             assert(cur_run_size > m2);
00306 
00307             for (i = 0; i < m2; ++i)
00308             {
00309                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00310                 write_reqs[i]->wait();
00311                 write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00312             }
00313 
00314             request_ptr * write_reqs1 = new request_ptr[cur_run_size - m2];
00315 
00316             for ( ; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00317             {
00318                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00319                 write_reqs1[i - m2] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00320             }
00321 
00322             result_.runs[0] = run;
00323 
00324             wait_all(write_reqs, write_reqs + m2);
00325             delete [] write_reqs;
00326             wait_all(write_reqs1, write_reqs1 + cur_run_size - m2);
00327             delete [] write_reqs1;
00328 
00329             delete [] Blocks1;
00330 
00331             return;
00332         }
00333 
00334         sort_run(Blocks2, pos);
00335 
00336         cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(pos, block_type::size); // in blocks
00337         run.resize(cur_run_size);
00338         bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00339                        trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.begin()),
00340                        trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.end())
00341         );
00342 
00343         for (i = 0; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00344         {
00345             run[i].value = Blocks2[i][0];
00346             write_reqs[i]->wait();
00347             write_reqs[i] = Blocks2[i].write(run[i].bid);
00348         }
00349         assert((pos % el_in_run) == 0);
00350 
00351         result_.runs.push_back(run);
00352         result_.runs_sizes.push_back(pos);
00353 
00354         while (!input.empty())
00355         {
00356             pos = 0;
00357             while (!input.empty() && pos != el_in_run)
00358             {
00359                 Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = *input;
00360                 ++input;
00361                 ++pos;
00362             }
00363             result_.elements += pos;
00364             sort_run(Blocks1, pos);
00365             cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(pos, block_type::size); // in blocks
00366             run.resize(cur_run_size);
00367             bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00368                            trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.begin()),
00369                            trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.end())
00370             );
00371 
00372             result_.runs_sizes.push_back(pos);
00373 
00374             // fill the rest of the last block with max values (occurs only on the last run)
00375             for ( ; pos != el_in_run; ++pos)
00376                 Blocks1[pos / block_type::size][pos % block_type::size] = cmp.max_value();
00377 
00378 
00379             for (i = 0; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00380             {
00381                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00382                 write_reqs[i]->wait();
00383                 write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00384             }
00385             result_.runs.push_back(run); // #
00386 
00387             std::swap(Blocks1, Blocks2);
00388         }
00389 
00390         wait_all(write_reqs, write_reqs + m2);
00391         delete [] write_reqs;
00392         delete [] ((Blocks1 < Blocks2) ? Blocks1 : Blocks2);
00393     }
00394 
00395 
00403     template <class ValueType_>
00404     struct use_push
00405     {
00406         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
00407     };
00408 
00420     template <
00421               class ValueType_,
00422               class Cmp_,
00423               unsigned BlockSize_,
00424               class AllocStr_>
00425     class runs_creator<
00426                        use_push<ValueType_>,
00427                        Cmp_,
00428                        BlockSize_,
00429                        AllocStr_>
00430     {
00431         Cmp_ cmp;
00432     public:
00433         typedef Cmp_ cmp_type;
00434         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
00435         typedef BID<BlockSize_> bid_type;
00436         typedef typed_block<BlockSize_, value_type> block_type;
00437         typedef sort_local::trigger_entry<bid_type, value_type> trigger_entry_type;
00438         typedef sorted_runs<value_type, trigger_entry_type> sorted_runs_type;
00439     private:
00440         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::run_type run_type;
00441         sorted_runs_type result_; // stores the result (sorted runs)
00442         unsigned_type m_; // memory for internal use in blocks
00443 
00444         bool output_requested; // true after the result() method was called for the first time
00445 
00446         const unsigned_type m2;
00447         const unsigned_type el_in_run;
00448         unsigned_type cur_el;
00449         block_type * Blocks1;
00450         block_type * Blocks2;
00451         request_ptr * write_reqs;
00452         run_type run;
00453 
00454 
00455         runs_creator(); // default construction is forbidden
00456         runs_creator(const runs_creator & ); // copy construction is forbidden
00457         runs_creator & operator = (const runs_creator &); // copying is forbidden
00458 
00459 
00460         void sort_run(block_type * run, unsigned_type elements)
00461         {
00462             if (block_type::has_filler)
00463                 std::sort(
00464                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor <
00465                                                 block_type,
00466                                                 value_type,
00467                                                 block_type::size > (run, 0 ),
00468                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor<
00469                                                block_type,
00470                                                value_type,
00471                                                block_type::size > (run,
00472                                                                    elements ),
00473                     cmp);
00474 
00475             else
00476                 std::sort(run[0].elem, run[0].elem + elements, cmp);
00477         }
00478         void finish_result()
00479         {
00480             if (cur_el == 0)
00481                 return;
00482 
00483 
00484             unsigned_type cur_el_reg = cur_el;
00485             sort_run(Blocks1, cur_el_reg);
00486             result_.elements += cur_el_reg;
00487             if (cur_el_reg < unsigned_type(block_type::size) &&
00488                 unsigned_type(result_.elements) == cur_el_reg)         // small input, do not flush it on the disk(s)
00489             {
00490                 STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_creator(use_push): Small input optimization, input length: " << cur_el_reg);
00491                 result_.small_.resize(cur_el_reg);
00492                 std::copy(Blocks1[0].begin(), Blocks1[0].begin() + cur_el_reg, result_.small_.begin());
00493                 return;
00494             }
00495 
00496             const unsigned_type cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(cur_el_reg, block_type::size);     // in blocks
00497             run.resize(cur_run_size);
00498             block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00499             bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00500                            trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.begin()),
00501                            trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.end())
00502             );
00503 
00504             disk_queues::get_instance ()->set_priority_op(disk_queue::WRITE);
00505 
00506             result_.runs_sizes.push_back(cur_el_reg);
00507 
00508             // fill the rest of the last block with max values
00509             for ( ; cur_el_reg != el_in_run; ++cur_el_reg)
00510                 Blocks1[cur_el_reg / block_type::size][cur_el_reg % block_type::size] = cmp.max_value();
00511 
00512 
00513             unsigned_type i = 0;
00514             for ( ; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00515             {
00516                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00517                 if (write_reqs[i].get())
00518                     write_reqs[i]->wait();
00519 
00520                 write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00521             }
00522             result_.runs.push_back(run);
00523 
00524             for (i = 0; i < m2; ++i)
00525                 if (write_reqs[i].get())
00526                     write_reqs[i]->wait();
00527         }
00528         void cleanup()
00529         {
00530             delete [] write_reqs;
00531             delete [] ((Blocks1 < Blocks2) ? Blocks1 : Blocks2);
00532             write_reqs = NULL;
00533             Blocks1 = Blocks2 = NULL;
00534         }
00535     public:
00539         runs_creator(Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
00540             cmp(c), m_(memory_to_use / BlockSize_ / sort_memory_usage_factor()), output_requested(false),
00541             m2(m_ / 2),
00542             el_in_run(m2 * block_type::size),
00543             cur_el(0),
00544             Blocks1(new block_type[m2 * 2]),
00545             Blocks2(Blocks1 + m2),
00546             write_reqs(new request_ptr[m2])
00547         {
00548             assert (2 * BlockSize_ * sort_memory_usage_factor() <= memory_to_use);
00549         }
00550 
00551         ~runs_creator()
00552         {
00553             if (!output_requested)
00554                 cleanup();
00555         }
00556 
00559         void push(const value_type & val)
00560         {
00561             assert(output_requested == false);
00562             unsigned_type cur_el_reg = cur_el;
00563             if (cur_el_reg < el_in_run)
00564             {
00565                 Blocks1[cur_el_reg / block_type::size][cur_el_reg % block_type::size] = val;
00566                 ++cur_el;
00567                 return;
00568             }
00569 
00570             assert(el_in_run == cur_el);
00571             cur_el = 0;
00572 
00573             //sort and store Blocks1
00574             sort_run(Blocks1, el_in_run);
00575             result_.elements += el_in_run;
00576 
00577             const unsigned_type cur_run_size = div_and_round_up(el_in_run, block_type::size);    // in blocks
00578             run.resize(cur_run_size);
00579             block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
00580             bm->new_blocks(AllocStr_(),
00581                            trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.begin()),
00582                            trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (run.end())
00583             );
00584 
00585             disk_queues::get_instance ()->set_priority_op(disk_queue::WRITE);
00586 
00587             result_.runs_sizes.push_back(el_in_run);
00588 
00589             for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < cur_run_size; ++i)
00590             {
00591                 run[i].value = Blocks1[i][0];
00592                 if ( write_reqs[i].get() )
00593                     write_reqs[i]->wait();
00594 
00595                 write_reqs[i] = Blocks1[i].write(run[i].bid);
00596             }
00597 
00598             result_.runs.push_back(run);
00599 
00600             std::swap(Blocks1, Blocks2);
00601 
00602             push(val);
00603         }
00604 
00608         const sorted_runs_type & result()
00609         {
00610             if (!output_requested)
00611             {
00612                 finish_result();
00613                 output_requested = true;
00614                 cleanup();
00615 #ifdef STXXL_PRINT_STAT_AFTER_RF
00616                 STXXL_MSG(*stats::get_instance());
00617 #endif
00618             }
00619             return result_;
00620         }
00621     };
00622 
00623 
00624 
00631     template <class ValueType_>
00632     struct from_sorted_sequences
00633     {
00634         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
00635     };
00636 
00648     template <
00649               class ValueType_,
00650               class Cmp_,
00651               unsigned BlockSize_,
00652               class AllocStr_>
00653     class runs_creator<
00654                        from_sorted_sequences<ValueType_>,
00655                        Cmp_,
00656                        BlockSize_,
00657                        AllocStr_>
00658     {
00659         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
00660         typedef BID<BlockSize_> bid_type;
00661         typedef typed_block<BlockSize_, value_type> block_type;
00662         typedef sort_local::trigger_entry<bid_type, value_type> trigger_entry_type;
00663         typedef AllocStr_ alloc_strategy_type;
00664         Cmp_ cmp;
00665 
00666     public:
00667         typedef Cmp_ cmp_type;
00668         typedef sorted_runs<value_type, trigger_entry_type> sorted_runs_type;
00669     private:
00670         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::run_type run_type;
00671         sorted_runs_type result_; // stores the result (sorted runs)
00672         unsigned_type m_; // memory for internal use in blocks
00673         buffered_writer<block_type>  writer;
00674         block_type * cur_block;
00675         unsigned_type offset;
00676         unsigned_type iblock;
00677         unsigned_type irun;
00678         alloc_strategy_type alloc_strategy;
00679 
00680         runs_creator(); // default construction is forbidden
00681         runs_creator(const runs_creator & ); // copy construction is forbidden
00682         runs_creator & operator = (const runs_creator &); // copying is forbidden
00683 
00684     public:
00689         runs_creator(Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
00690             cmp(c),
00691             m_(memory_to_use / BlockSize_ / sort_memory_usage_factor()),
00692             writer(m_, m_ / 2),
00693             cur_block(writer.get_free_block()),
00694             offset(0),
00695             iblock(0),
00696             irun(0)
00697         {
00698             assert (2 * BlockSize_ * sort_memory_usage_factor() <= memory_to_use);
00699         }
00700 
00703         void push(const value_type & val)
00704         {
00705             assert(offset < block_type::size );
00706 
00707             (*cur_block)[offset] = val;
00708             ++offset;
00709 
00710             if (offset == block_type::size)
00711             {
00712                 // write current block
00713 
00714                 block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance ();
00715                 // allocate space for the block
00716                 result_.runs.resize(irun + 1);
00717                 result_.runs[irun].resize( iblock + 1 );
00718                 bm->new_blocks(
00719                     offset_allocator < alloc_strategy_type > (iblock, alloc_strategy),
00720                     trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (result_.runs[irun].begin()
00721                                                                                                   + iblock),
00722                     trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (result_.runs[irun].end())
00723                 );
00724 
00725                 result_.runs[irun][iblock].value = (*cur_block)[0];         // init trigger
00726                 cur_block = writer.write(cur_block, result_.runs[irun][iblock].bid);
00727                 ++iblock;
00728 
00729                 offset = 0;
00730             }
00731 
00732             ++result_.elements;
00733         }
00734 
00736         void finish()
00737         {
00738             if (offset == 0 && iblock == 0)  // current run is empty
00739                 return;
00740 
00741 
00742             result_.runs_sizes.resize(irun + 1);
00743             result_.runs_sizes.back() = iblock * block_type::size + offset;
00744 
00745             if (offset)    // if current block is parially filled
00746             {
00747                 while (offset != block_type::size)
00748                 {
00749                     (*cur_block)[offset] = cmp.max_value();
00750                     ++offset;
00751                 }
00752                 offset = 0;
00753 
00754                 block_manager *  bm = block_manager::get_instance ();
00755                 // allocate space for the block
00756                 result_.runs.resize(irun + 1);
00757                 result_.runs[irun].resize( iblock + 1 );
00758                 bm->new_blocks(
00759                     offset_allocator < alloc_strategy_type > (iblock, alloc_strategy),
00760                     trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (result_.runs[irun].begin()
00761                                                                                                   + iblock),
00762                     trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (result_.runs[irun].end())
00763                 );
00764 
00765                 result_.runs[irun][iblock].value = (*cur_block)[0];         // init trigger
00766                 cur_block = writer.write(cur_block, result_.runs[irun][iblock].bid);
00767             }
00768             else
00769             { }
00770 
00771             iblock = 0;
00772             ++irun;
00773         }
00774 
00778         const sorted_runs_type & result()
00779         {
00780             finish();
00781             writer.flush();
00782 
00783             return result_;
00784         }
00785     };
00786 
00787 
00788 
00793     template <class RunsType_, class Cmp_>
00794     bool check_sorted_runs(RunsType_ & sruns, Cmp_ cmp)
00795     {
00796         typedef typename RunsType_::block_type block_type;
00797         typedef typename block_type::value_type value_type;
00798         STXXL_VERBOSE2("Elements: " << sruns.elements);
00799         unsigned_type nruns = sruns.runs.size();
00800         STXXL_VERBOSE2("Runs: " << nruns);
00801         unsigned_type irun = 0;
00802         for (irun = 0; irun < nruns; ++irun)
00803         {
00804             const unsigned_type nblocks = sruns.runs[irun].size();
00805             block_type * blocks = new block_type[nblocks];
00806             request_ptr * reqs = new request_ptr[nblocks];
00807             for (unsigned_type j = 0; j < nblocks; ++j)
00808             {
00809                 reqs[j] = blocks[j].read(sruns.runs[irun][j].bid);
00810             }
00811             wait_all(reqs, reqs + nblocks);
00812             for (unsigned_type j = 0; j < nblocks; ++j)
00813             {
00814                 if (blocks[j][0] != sruns.runs[irun][j].value)
00815                 {
00816                     STXXL_ERRMSG("check_sorted_runs  wrong trigger in the run");
00817                     return false;
00818                 }
00819             }
00820             if (!is_sorted(
00821                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor <
00822                                                 block_type,
00823                                                 value_type,
00824                                                 block_type::size > (blocks, 0 ),
00825                     TwoToOneDimArrayRowAdaptor<
00826                                                block_type,
00827                                                value_type,
00828                                                block_type::size > (blocks,
00829                                                                    //nblocks*block_type::size
00830                                                                    //(irun<nruns-1)?(nblocks*block_type::size): (sruns.elements%(nblocks*block_type::size))
00831                                                                    sruns.runs_sizes[irun]
00832                     ), cmp) )
00833             {
00834                 STXXL_ERRMSG("check_sorted_runs  wrong order in the run");
00835                 return false;
00836             }
00837 
00838             delete [] reqs;
00839             delete [] blocks;
00840         }
00841 
00842         STXXL_MSG("Checking runs finished successfully");
00843 
00844         return true;
00845     }
00846 
00847 
00848 
00856     template <  class RunsType_,
00857               class Cmp_,
00858               class AllocStr_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY >
00859     class runs_merger
00860     {
00861         typedef RunsType_ sorted_runs_type;
00862         typedef AllocStr_ alloc_strategy;
00863         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::size_type size_type;
00864         typedef Cmp_ value_cmp;
00865         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::run_type run_type;
00866         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::block_type block_type;
00867         typedef typename block_type::bid_type bid_type;
00868         typedef block_prefetcher < block_type, typename run_type::iterator > prefetcher_type;
00869         typedef run_cursor2<block_type, prefetcher_type> run_cursor_type;
00870         typedef sort_local::run_cursor2_cmp<block_type, prefetcher_type, value_cmp> run_cursor2_cmp_type;
00871         typedef loser_tree<run_cursor_type, run_cursor2_cmp_type, block_type::size> loser_tree_type;
00872 
00873         typedef stxxl::int64 diff_type;
00874         typedef std::pair < typename block_type::iterator, typename block_type::iterator > sequence;
00875         typedef typename std::vector<sequence>::size_type seqs_size_type;
00876         std::vector<sequence>* seqs;
00877         std::vector<block_type *>* buffers;
00878 
00879 
00880 
00881         sorted_runs_type sruns;
00882         unsigned_type m_; //  blocks to use - 1
00883         value_cmp cmp;
00884         size_type elements_remaining;
00885         unsigned_type buffer_pos;
00886         block_type * current_block;
00887         run_type consume_seq;
00888         prefetcher_type * prefetcher;
00889         loser_tree_type * losers;
00890         int_type * prefetch_seq;
00891         unsigned_type nruns;
00892 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
00893         typename block_type::value_type last_element;
00894 #endif
00895 
00896         void merge_recursively();
00897 
00898         runs_merger(); // forbidden
00899         runs_merger(const runs_merger &); // forbidden
00900         runs_merger & operator = (const runs_merger &); // copying is forbidden
00901         void deallocate_prefetcher()
00902         {
00903             if (prefetcher)
00904             {
00905                 delete losers;
00906                 delete seqs;
00907                 delete buffers;
00908                 delete prefetcher;
00909                 delete [] prefetch_seq;
00910                 prefetcher = NULL;
00911             }
00912             // free blocks in runs , (or the user should do it?)
00913             sruns.deallocate_blocks();
00914         }
00915 
00916         void initialize_current_block()
00917         {
00918 #if defined (__MCSTL__) && defined (STXXL_PARALLEL_MULTIWAY_MERGE)
00919 
00920 // begin of STL-style merging
00921 
00922             //taks: merge
00923 
00924             if (!stxxl::SETTINGS::native_merge && mcstl::HEURISTIC::num_threads >= 1)
00925             {
00926                 seqs = new std::vector<sequence>(nruns);
00927                 buffers = new std::vector<block_type *> (nruns);
00928 
00929                 for (int_type i = 0; i < nruns; i++)            //initialize sequences
00930                 {
00931                     (*buffers)[i] = prefetcher->pull_block();           //get first block of each run
00932                     (*seqs)[i] = std::make_pair((*buffers)[i]->begin(), (*buffers)[i]->end());          //this memory location stays the same, only the data is exchanged
00933                 }
00934 
00935 // end of STL-style merging
00936             }
00937             else
00938             {
00939 #endif
00940 
00941 // begin of native merging procedure
00942 
00943             losers = new loser_tree_type(prefetcher, nruns, run_cursor2_cmp_type(cmp));
00944 
00945 // end of native merging procedure
00946 #if defined (__MCSTL__) && defined (STXXL_PARALLEL_MULTIWAY_MERGE)
00947         }
00948 #endif
00949         }
00950 
00951         void fill_current_block()
00952         {
00953 #if defined (__MCSTL__) && defined (STXXL_PARALLEL_MULTIWAY_MERGE)
00954 
00955 // begin of STL-style merging
00956 
00957             //taks: merge
00958 
00959             if (!stxxl::SETTINGS::native_merge && mcstl::HEURISTIC::num_threads >= 1)
00960             {
00961  #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
00962                 value_type last_elem;
00963  #endif
00964 
00965                 diff_type rest = block_type::size;                      //elements still to merge for this output block
00966 
00967                 do              //while rest > 0 and still elements available
00968                 {
00969                     value_type * min_last_element = NULL;               //no element found yet
00970                     diff_type total_size = 0;
00971 
00972                     for (seqs_size_type i = 0; i < (*seqs).size(); i++)
00973                     {
00974                         if ((*seqs)[i].first == (*seqs)[i].second)
00975                             continue; //run empty
00976 
00977                         if (min_last_element == NULL)
00978                             min_last_element = &(*((*seqs)[i].second - 1));
00979                         else
00980                             min_last_element = cmp(*min_last_element, *((*seqs)[i].second - 1)) ? min_last_element : &(*((*seqs)[i].second - 1));
00981 
00982                         total_size += (*seqs)[i].second - (*seqs)[i].first;
00983                         STXXL_VERBOSE1("last " << *((*seqs)[i].second - 1) << " block size " << ((*seqs)[i].second - (*seqs)[i].first));
00984                     }
00985 
00986                     assert(min_last_element != NULL);           //there must be some element
00987 
00988                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("min_last_element " << min_last_element << " total size " << total_size + (block_type::size - rest));
00989 
00990                     diff_type less_equal_than_min_last = 0;
00991                     //locate this element in all sequences
00992                     for (seqs_size_type i = 0; i < (*seqs).size(); i++)
00993                     {
00994                         if ((*seqs)[i].first == (*seqs)[i].second)
00995                             continue; //empty subsequence
00996 
00997                         typename block_type::iterator position = std::upper_bound((*seqs)[i].first, (*seqs)[i].second, *min_last_element, cmp);
00998                         STXXL_VERBOSE1("greater equal than " << position - (*seqs)[i].first);
00999                         less_equal_than_min_last += position - (*seqs)[i].first;
01000                     }
01001 
01002                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("finished loop");
01003 
01004                     ptrdiff_t output_size = (std::min)(less_equal_than_min_last, rest);                           //at most rest elements
01005 
01006                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("before merge" << output_size);
01007 
01008                     mcstl::multiway_merge((*seqs).begin(), (*seqs).end(), current_block->end() - rest, cmp, output_size, false);                         //sequence iterators are progressed appropriately
01009 
01010                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("after merge");
01011 
01012                     rest -= output_size;
01013 
01014                     STXXL_VERBOSE1("so long");
01015 
01016                     for (seqs_size_type i = 0; i < (*seqs).size(); i++)
01017                     {
01018                         if ((*seqs)[i].first == (*seqs)[i].second)                            //run empty
01019                         {
01020                             if (prefetcher->block_consumed((*buffers)[i]))
01021                             {
01022                                 (*seqs)[i].first = (*buffers)[i]->begin();                                    //reset iterator
01023                                 (*seqs)[i].second = (*buffers)[i]->end();
01024                                 STXXL_VERBOSE1("block ran empty " << i);
01025                             }
01026                             else
01027                             {
01028                                 (*seqs).erase((*seqs).begin() + i);                                   //remove this sequence
01029                                 (*buffers).erase((*buffers).begin() + i);
01030                                 STXXL_VERBOSE1("seq removed " << i);
01031                             }
01032                         }
01033                     }
01034                 } while (rest > 0 && (*seqs).size() > 0);
01035 
01036  #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01037                 if (!stxxl::is_sorted(current_block->begin(), current_block->end(), cmp))
01038                 {
01039                     for (value_type * i = current_block->begin() + 1; i != current_block->end(); i++)
01040                         if (cmp(*i, *(i - 1)))
01041                         {
01042                             STXXL_VERBOSE1("Error at position " << (i - current_block->begin()));
01043                         }
01044                     assert(false);
01045                 }
01046 
01047 
01048 
01049  #endif
01050 
01051 
01052 // end of STL-style merging
01053             }
01054             else
01055             {
01056 #endif
01057 
01058 // begin of native merging procedure
01059 
01060             losers->multi_merge(current_block->elem);
01061 
01062 #if defined (__MCSTL__) && defined (STXXL_PARALLEL_MULTIWAY_MERGE)
01063 // end of native merging procedure
01064         }
01065 #endif
01066         }
01067 
01068     public:
01070         typedef typename sorted_runs_type::value_type value_type;
01071 
01076         runs_merger(const sorted_runs_type & r, value_cmp c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
01077             sruns(r), m_(memory_to_use / block_type::raw_size / sort_memory_usage_factor() /* - 1 */), cmp(c),
01078             elements_remaining(r.elements),
01079             current_block(NULL),
01080 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01081             last_element(cmp.min_value()),
01082 #endif
01083             prefetcher(NULL)
01084         {
01085             if (empty())
01086                 return;
01087 
01088 
01089 
01090             if (!sruns.small_.empty()) // we have a small input < B,
01091             // that is kept in the main memory
01092             {
01093                 STXXL_VERBOSE1("runs_merger: small input optimization, input length: " << elements_remaining);
01094                 assert(elements_remaining == size_type(sruns.small_.size()));
01095                 current_block = new block_type;
01096                 std::copy(sruns.small_.begin(), sruns.small_.end(), current_block->begin());
01097                 current_value = current_block->elem[0];
01098                 buffer_pos = 1;
01099 
01100                 return;
01101             }
01102 
01103 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01104             assert(check_sorted_runs(r, c));
01105 #endif
01106 
01107             current_block = new block_type;
01108 
01109             disk_queues::get_instance ()->set_priority_op (disk_queue::WRITE);
01110 
01111             nruns = sruns.runs.size();
01112 
01113             if (m_ < nruns)
01114             {
01115                 // can not merge runs in one pass
01116                 // merge recursively:
01117                 STXXL_ERRMSG("The implementation of sort requires more than one merge pass, therefore for a better");
01118                 STXXL_ERRMSG("efficiency decrease block size of run storage (a parameter of the run_creator)");
01119                 STXXL_ERRMSG("or increase the amount memory dedicated to the merger.");
01120                 STXXL_ERRMSG("m = " << m_ << " nruns=" << nruns);
01121 
01122                 merge_recursively();
01123 
01124                 nruns = sruns.runs.size();
01125             }
01126 
01127             assert(nruns <= m_);
01128 
01129             unsigned_type i;
01130             /*
01131                const unsigned_type out_run_size =
01132                   div_and_round_up(elements_remaining,size_type(block_type::size));
01133              */
01134             unsigned_type prefetch_seq_size = 0;
01135             for (i = 0; i < nruns; i++)
01136             {
01137                 prefetch_seq_size += sruns.runs[i].size();
01138             }
01139 
01140             consume_seq.resize(prefetch_seq_size);
01141 
01142             prefetch_seq = new int_type[prefetch_seq_size];
01143 
01144             typename run_type::iterator copy_start = consume_seq.begin ();
01145             for (i = 0; i < nruns; i++)
01146             {
01147                 copy_start = std::copy(
01148                     sruns.runs[i].begin (),
01149                     sruns.runs[i].end (),
01150                     copy_start      );
01151             }
01152 
01153             std::stable_sort(consume_seq.begin (), consume_seq.end (),
01154                              sort_local::trigger_entry_cmp<bid_type, value_type, value_cmp>(cmp));
01155 
01156             int_type disks_number = config::get_instance ()->disks_number ();
01157 
01158             const int_type n_prefetch_buffers = STXXL_MAX( 2 * disks_number, (int_type(m_) - int_type(nruns)) );
01159 
01160 
01161 #ifdef SORT_OPTIMAL_PREFETCHING
01162             // heuristic
01163             const int_type n_opt_prefetch_buffers = 2 * disks_number + (3 * (n_prefetch_buffers - 2 * disks_number)) / 10;
01164 
01165             compute_prefetch_schedule(
01166                 consume_seq,
01167                 prefetch_seq,
01168                 n_opt_prefetch_buffers,
01169                 disks_number );
01170 #else
01171             for (i = 0; i < prefetch_seq_size; ++i)
01172                 prefetch_seq[i] = i;
01173 
01174 #endif
01175 
01176 
01177             prefetcher = new prefetcher_type(
01178                 consume_seq.begin(),
01179                 consume_seq.end(),
01180                 prefetch_seq,
01181                 nruns + n_prefetch_buffers);
01182 
01183             losers = NULL;
01184             seqs = NULL;
01185             buffers = NULL;
01186 
01187             initialize_current_block();
01188             fill_current_block();
01189 
01190 
01191             current_value = current_block->elem[0];
01192             buffer_pos = 1;
01193 
01194             if (elements_remaining <= block_type::size)
01195                 deallocate_prefetcher();
01196         }
01197 
01199         bool empty() const
01200         {
01201             return elements_remaining == 0;
01202         }
01204         runs_merger & operator ++() // preincrement operator
01205         {
01206             assert(!empty());
01207 
01208             --elements_remaining;
01209 
01210             if (buffer_pos != block_type::size)
01211             {
01212                 current_value = current_block->elem[buffer_pos];
01213                 ++buffer_pos;
01214             }
01215             else
01216             {
01217                 if (!empty())
01218                 {
01219                     fill_current_block();
01220 
01221 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01222                     assert(is_sorted(current_block->elem, current_block->elem + current_block->size, cmp));
01223                     assert(!cmp(current_block->elem[0], current_value));
01224 #endif
01225                     current_value = current_block->elem[0];
01226                     buffer_pos = 1;
01227                 }
01228                 if (elements_remaining <= block_type::size)
01229                     deallocate_prefetcher();
01230             }
01231 
01232 
01233 #ifdef STXXL_CHECK_ORDER_IN_SORTS
01234             if (!empty())
01235             {
01236                 assert(!cmp(current_value, last_element));
01237                 last_element = current_value;
01238             }
01239 #endif
01240 
01241             return *this;
01242         }
01244         const value_type & operator * () const
01245         {
01246             assert(!empty());
01247             return current_value;
01248         }
01249 
01251         const value_type * operator -> () const
01252         {
01253             assert(!empty());
01254             return &current_value;
01255         }
01256 
01257 
01260         virtual ~runs_merger()
01261         {
01262             deallocate_prefetcher();
01263 
01264             if (current_block)
01265                 delete current_block;
01266 
01267             // free blocks in runs , (or the user should do it?)
01268             sruns.deallocate_blocks();
01269         }
01270     private:
01271         // cache for the current value
01272         value_type current_value;
01273     };
01274 
01275 
01276     template <class RunsType_, class Cmp_, class AllocStr_>
01277     void runs_merger<RunsType_, Cmp_, AllocStr_>::merge_recursively()
01278     {
01279         block_manager * bm = block_manager::get_instance();
01280         unsigned_type ndisks = config::get_instance ()->disks_number ();
01281         unsigned_type nwrite_buffers = 2 * ndisks;
01282 
01283         unsigned_type nruns = sruns.runs.size();
01284         const unsigned_type merge_factor = static_cast<unsigned_type>(ceil(pow(nruns, 1. / ceil(
01285                                                                                    log(double (nruns)) / log(double (m_))))));
01286         assert(merge_factor <= m_);
01287         while (nruns > m_)
01288         {
01289             unsigned_type new_nruns = div_and_round_up(nruns, merge_factor);
01290             STXXL_VERBOSE("Starting new merge phase: nruns: " << nruns <<
01291                           " opt_merge_factor: " << merge_factor << " m:" << m_ << " new_nruns: " << new_nruns);
01292 
01293             sorted_runs_type new_runs;
01294             new_runs.runs.resize(new_nruns);
01295             new_runs.runs_sizes.resize(new_nruns);
01296             new_runs.elements = sruns.elements;
01297 
01298             unsigned_type runs_left = nruns;
01299             unsigned_type cur_out_run = 0;
01300             unsigned_type elements_in_new_run = 0;
01301             //unsigned_type blocks_in_new_run = 0;
01302 
01303 
01304             while (runs_left > 0)
01305             {
01306                 int_type runs2merge = STXXL_MIN(runs_left, merge_factor);
01307                 //blocks_in_new_run = 0 ;
01308                 elements_in_new_run = 0;
01309                 for (unsigned_type i = nruns - runs_left; i < (nruns - runs_left + runs2merge); ++i)
01310                 {
01311                     elements_in_new_run += sruns.runs_sizes[i];
01312                     //blocks_in_new_run += sruns.runs[i].size();
01313                 }
01314                 const unsigned_type blocks_in_new_run1 = div_and_round_up(elements_in_new_run, block_type::size);
01315                 //assert(blocks_in_new_run1 == blocks_in_new_run);
01316 
01317                 new_runs.runs_sizes[cur_out_run] = elements_in_new_run;
01318                 // allocate run
01319                 new_runs.runs[cur_out_run++].resize(blocks_in_new_run1);
01320                 runs_left -= runs2merge;
01321             }
01322 
01323             // allocate blocks for the new runs
01324             for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < new_runs.runs.size(); ++i)
01325                 bm->new_blocks( alloc_strategy(),
01326                                 trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (new_runs.runs[i].begin()),
01327                                 trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (new_runs.runs[i].end()) );
01328 
01329 
01330             // merge all
01331             runs_left = nruns;
01332             cur_out_run = 0;
01333             size_type elements_left = sruns.elements;
01334 
01335             while (runs_left > 0)
01336             {
01337                 unsigned_type runs2merge = STXXL_MIN(runs_left, merge_factor);
01338                 STXXL_VERBOSE("Merging " << runs2merge << " runs");
01339 
01340                 sorted_runs_type cur_runs;
01341                 cur_runs.runs.resize(runs2merge);
01342                 cur_runs.runs_sizes.resize(runs2merge);
01343 
01344                 std::copy(sruns.runs.begin() + nruns - runs_left,
01345                           sruns.runs.begin() + nruns - runs_left + runs2merge,
01346                           cur_runs.runs.begin() );
01347                 std::copy(sruns.runs_sizes.begin() + nruns - runs_left,
01348                           sruns.runs_sizes.begin() + nruns - runs_left + runs2merge,
01349                           cur_runs.runs_sizes.begin() );
01350 
01351                 runs_left -= runs2merge;
01352                 /*
01353                    cur_runs.elements = (runs_left)?
01354                    (new_runs.runs[cur_out_run].size()*block_type::size):
01355                    (elements_left);
01356                  */
01357                 cur_runs.elements = new_runs.runs_sizes[cur_out_run];
01358                 elements_left -= cur_runs.elements;
01359 
01360                 if (runs2merge > 1)
01361                 {
01362                     runs_merger<RunsType_, Cmp_, AllocStr_> merger(cur_runs, cmp, m_ * block_type::raw_size);
01363 
01364                     { // make sure everything is being destroyed in right time
01365                         buf_ostream < block_type, typename run_type::iterator > out(
01366                             new_runs.runs[cur_out_run].begin(),
01367                             nwrite_buffers );
01368 
01369                         size_type cnt = 0;
01370                         const size_type cnt_max = cur_runs.elements;
01371 
01372                         while (cnt != cnt_max)
01373                         {
01374                             *out = *merger;
01375                             if ( (cnt % block_type::size) == 0)  // have to write the trigger value
01376                                 new_runs.runs[cur_out_run][cnt / size_type(block_type::size)].value = *merger;
01377 
01378 
01379                             ++cnt;
01380                             ++out;
01381                             ++merger;
01382                         }
01383                         assert(merger.empty());
01384 
01385                         while (cnt % block_type::size)
01386                         {
01387                             *out = cmp.max_value();
01388                             ++out;
01389                             ++cnt;
01390                         }
01391                     }
01392                 }
01393                 else
01394                 {
01395                     bm->delete_blocks(
01396                         trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (
01397                             new_runs.runs.back().begin()),
01398                         trigger_entry_iterator < typename run_type::iterator, block_type::raw_size > (
01399                             new_runs.runs.back().end()) );
01400 
01401                     assert(cur_runs.runs.size() == 1);
01402 
01403                     std::copy(cur_runs.runs.front().begin(),
01404                               cur_runs.runs.front().end(),
01405                               new_runs.runs.back().begin());
01406                     new_runs.runs_sizes.back() = cur_runs.runs_sizes.back();
01407                 }
01408 
01409                 ++cur_out_run;
01410             }
01411             assert(elements_left == 0);
01412 
01413             nruns = new_nruns;
01414             sruns = new_runs;
01415         }
01416     }
01417 
01418 
01427     template <  class Input_,
01428               class Cmp_,
01429               unsigned BlockSize_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE (typename Input_::value_type),
01430               class AllocStr_ = STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY>
01431     class sort
01432     {
01433         typedef runs_creator<Input_, Cmp_, BlockSize_, AllocStr_> runs_creator_type;
01434         typedef typename runs_creator_type::sorted_runs_type sorted_runs_type;
01435         typedef runs_merger<sorted_runs_type, Cmp_, AllocStr_> runs_merger_type;
01436 
01437         runs_creator_type creator;
01438         runs_merger_type merger;
01439 
01440         sort(); // forbidden
01441         sort(const sort &); // forbidden
01442     public:
01444         typedef typename Input_::value_type value_type;
01445 
01450         sort(Input_ & in, Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use) :
01451             creator(in, c, memory_to_use),
01452             merger(creator.result(), c, memory_to_use)
01453         { }
01454 
01460         sort(Input_ & in, Cmp_ c, unsigned_type memory_to_use_rc, unsigned_type memory_to_use_m) :
01461             creator(in, c, memory_to_use_rc),
01462             merger(creator.result(), c, memory_to_use_m)
01463         { }
01464 
01465 
01467         const value_type & operator * () const
01468         {
01469             assert(!empty());
01470             return *merger;
01471         }
01472 
01473         const value_type * operator -> () const
01474         {
01475             assert(!empty());
01476             return merger.operator->();
01477         }
01478 
01480         sort & operator ++()
01481         {
01482             ++merger;
01483             return *this;
01484         }
01485 
01487         bool empty() const
01488         {
01489             return merger.empty();
01490         }
01491     };
01492 
01498     template <
01499               class ValueType_,
01500               unsigned BlockSize_>
01501     class compute_sorted_runs_type
01502     {
01503         typedef ValueType_ value_type;
01504         typedef BID<BlockSize_> bid_type;
01505         typedef sort_local::trigger_entry<bid_type, value_type> trigger_entry_type;
01506     public:
01507         typedef sorted_runs<value_type, trigger_entry_type> result;
01508     };
01509 
01511 }
01512 
01515 
01517 
01526 template <      unsigned BlockSize,
01527           class RandomAccessIterator,
01528           class CmpType,
01529           class AllocStr>
01530 void sort(RandomAccessIterator begin,
01531           RandomAccessIterator end,
01532           CmpType cmp,
01533           unsigned_type MemSize,
01534           AllocStr AS)
01535 {
01536     UNUSED(AS);
01537 #ifdef BOOST_MSVC
01538     typedef typename streamify_traits<RandomAccessIterator>::stream_type InputType;
01539 #else
01540     typedef typeof(stream::streamify(begin, end)) InputType;
01541 #endif
01542     InputType Input(begin, end);
01543     typedef stream::sort<InputType, CmpType, BlockSize, AllocStr> sorter_type;
01544     sorter_type Sort(Input, cmp, MemSize);
01545     stream::materialize(Sort, begin);
01546 }
